content:
Hello Mrs. Murdo, what can I do for you?
mrs. murdo: I have a student, Alicia, who has demonstrated exceptional knowledge and understanding beyond what is expected of a 1st grader. She is interested in being placed in 4th grade.
vice principal: I see. Can you tell me more about her abilities and knowledge level?
mrs. murdo: Yes, Alicia has shown a deep understanding of mathematics, language, and science concepts beyond what we cover in the 1st grade curriculum. She has also demonstrated proficiency in Turkish, which is not typically taught until the 4th grade.
vice principal: Interesting. I will need to assess her abilities and see if she is ready for the 4th grade curriculum. Can you arrange for her to take some assessments?
mrs. murdo: Of course, I will make the necessary arrangements and have her take the assessments as soon as possible.
vice principal: Great, let's plan to reconvene and discuss the results once the assessments are complete. Thank you for bringing this to my attention, Mrs. Murdo.
